title: Include the provided i-wanna-be-yours.mp3 file in the frontend assets for background music

requirements.text: Add the user-provided MP3 file to the repository so the existing background-music code can load it at runtime. Specifically, include the attached audio file as a static frontend asset at frontend/public/assets/audio/i-wanna-be-yours.mp3 (matching the current reference getAssetUrl('audio/i-wanna-be-yours.mp3')).

quotes: i see that u have added assets/i-wanna-be-yours.mp3 but i dont see this file uploaded anywhere kindly put this file into the code which im attaching for bg music

acceptanceCriteria: A file exists at frontend/public/assets/audio/i-wanna-be-yours.mp3 in the codebase.
The deployed site successfully requests and loads the MP3 from the correct SPA base path (i.e., via the existing getAssetUrl('audio/i-wanna-be-yours.mp3') behavior) without a 404.
After the user accepts the intro overlay and unmutes background music, the track plays and loops; when the user mutes it stops/pause as expected.

constraints: Frontend immutable paths must not be edited: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/components/ui.
Do not hardcode root-relative asset paths (e.g., '/assets/...'); keep BASE_URL-safe asset loading via getAssetUrl.
nonGoals: Do not change the background-music UX/controls, autoplay-gating logic, or stop-on-exit behavior beyond what is required to ensure the MP3 file is actually present and loadable.
